resources.string: Automatically close all connections when the VPN link fails
Try to detect falsely accepted connections

This program simulates an unencrypted OpenVPN server on port 41927.
 
 Configuration steps:

 1) Enable USB debugging on the phone. From the home screen, this is under Settings>Applications>Development>USB debugging.

 2) On the host, run "adb forward tcp:41927 tcp:41927" to set up port forwarding.

 3) On the phone, run AziLink and make sure "Service active" is checked.

 4) Right click AziLink.ovpn on the host and select "Start OpenVPN on this configuration file". A copy of this text file appears below.

dev tun
 remote 127.0.0.1 41927 tcp-client
 ifconfig 192.168.56.2 192.168.56.1
 route 0.0.0.0 128.0.0.0
 route 128.0.0.0 128.0.0.0
 socket-flags TCP_NODELAY
 keepalive 10 30
 dhcp-option DNS 192.168.56.1

T-Mobile's transparent proxy automatically accepts all outgoing connections. This can sometimes create a problem when the target server refuses a connection, since the host will see a successful connection followed by an immediate close. The T-Mobile workaround in the advanced menu tries to detect this by stalling all connection attempts for a configured length of time. If the connection still exists afterwards (or if any data is received from the remote end), then the connection succeeds. Since this can degrade overall performance, it's disabled by default.
 
 Since this program doesn't run as root, it cannot forward ICMP-based ping requests. To simulate this, all pings are translated internally into UDP pings. Unfortunately, many hosts do not respond to UDP ping requests.
Close VPN if no ping within 30 seconds
